file_content.text: Lord Silthar?
Did Captain Golah send you? Such a good man. Heh. A pity he didn't send young Hael....
But the honor is yours. You will hear my last words.
What?
Slowly. You're not going to die, my lord.
You'll survive this.
It is kind of you to lie.
A pitiful death for a pitiful Sith.
Pathetic.
You think so? Oh, but you haven't seen what I have seen.
The Force called me into the desert. I sensed what Czerka found... an alien power. I saw a white room.
I thought the Sand People would know the land's secrets. I murdered them... stole their thoughts to find this cave. I knew victory before they destroyed me.
I followed the shaman's compass. But what is this place?
Tell me about this cave.
It is a cave of secrets.
Let me aid you.
Your story's amusing--but this is pointless.
So you're dead. I don't care.
Forgive me for prattling on.
My journey here was not for nothing. Czerka built its base over a site from the natives' myths--a forbidden land.
The paintings in the cave show the way. Find them, record them. Golah and his men, they... ah!
Your journey's over, Lord Silthar.
We'll finish the mission, my lord. One way or another.
You're a creep, Silthar, but you paid your bills. More than I can say for some.
Find the paintings. But beware--beware the thing in the white room....
Time to die. Goodbye, Silthar.
Enough. [Kill him]
So soon. So soon....
All right. Guess that makes the Jawas our next lead to the Czerka base.
What's a Jawa?
Jawas?
Would the Jawas trade with the sons?
What about the Sons of Palawa?
They'll sell their goods to anyone. Mos Ila was originally their trading post.
I'm still waiting to hear something useful.
You're boring me now.
You're with the Reclamation Service. This is "useful."
Settle down, Keighlah. Even if you do have a point.
The Jawas are one of the native species. Primitive masters of machinery.
They swarm like rats during the trade season, selling droid parts and generators. Then it's back to the desert.
In my dreams, I see one band that remains in the wastes near this city. Find them. I must meditate.
I will hunt them through fire and dust.
The Jawas will not escape.
Yes. No savage could escape a Sith like yourself.
While you "meditate," I'll bring us a step closer to Czerka.
Then I'll do what you can't.
So much confidence. I do hope it's warranted.
I hope Czerka's secret is worth such cost and effort, my lord.
The Empire had better benefit.
It will be. It must be.
This is a job to me. When do I get paid?
What about my money?
Hm? When you return, I think. Then you can have your credits.
Very well.
You may go.
Why does it have to be me?
Captain Golah and his team could go... but Keighlah would die, torn apart by wraids. Hael would fall, exhausted from thirst.
I don't foresee anyone surviving to meet the Jawas. No--this mission suits your skills.
Show the verbobrains to the Jawas, see if they can't identify the source. They won't have records, but they're clever.
Good hunting. Stay hydrated, stay safe, and stay cautious.
What's wrong, Hael? I can sense your fear.
Sorry, my lord. I'm--I'm remembering that time on Ziost, when I was buried alive.
That's good! Use that fear, Hael... let it push you.
Ah. Did you bring us the droid minds?
I obtained the parts, but it riled up the tribals.
It caused some trouble.
That is of no concern. The Sons of Palawa will not trouble us.
The job is done.
Your little job is finished.
I ran your errand.
I sense we'll do incredible things together. Czerka's discovery is out there somewhere... sending ripples through the Force.
Let's get the verbobrains analyzed, my lord. Keighlah...?
Memory wipe destroyed the old files, but it looks like the Sons of Palawa bought the droids from Jawas.
Welcome to our little expedition. Together, we will discover so much.
I'm pleased you could serve me, Lord Silthar... but it looks like your time is up.
You've outlived your use.
Your crew is mine, now. They will do as I please.
They will serve me.
No. My memory... it will stay with them. They will serve me still. Me.
Rest now.
